text: Ronald Dale Earle (February 23, 1942 - April 5, 2020) was an American Democratic politician and lawyer. He was born in Fort Worth, Texas. From 1977 to 2009, he was the District Attorney of Travis County, Texas. He was known for being the lawyer that prosecuted House Majority Leader Tom DeLay for money laundering. Earle died on April 5, 2020 in Austin, Texas after a long-illness, aged 78.BREAKING: Former Travis County DA Ronnie Earle has died ==References== Category:1942 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Lawyers from Austin Category:American judges Category:District attorneys Category:Politicians from Fort Worth, Texas Category:Politicians from Austin, Texas Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:Lawyers from Fort Worth
title: Ronnie Earle
